summary:
May: You were stabbed. Do you remember anything?
Peter: Only the ambulance ride to the hospital.
May: That wasn't an ambulance,...
body:
May: You were stabbed. Do you remember anything?

Peter: Only the ambulance ride to the hospital.

May: That wasn’t an ambulance, I drove you.

Peter: But I heard a siren.

MJ: That was Ned screaming.

Ned: I won’t apologize for my blood phobia.

summary: turn back the clock (and I’ll try again in the morning)
title: turn back the clock (and I’ll try again in the morning)
body:
Peter gets stuck in a time loop. In it, he lives through some of his worst nightmares, only to wake up that morning and have no one remember. He needs Tony to help him get through.

And if that isn’t bad enough, his identity is revealed over and over, every day.

Chapter 1

Part of the 2019 Irondad Big Bang, in collaboration with the unbelievably talented @starlight-sparks (who drew the gorgeous picture above) and @the-reverse-mermaid

summary: hi! for a little blurb request... with 'don't get up - i'll do it' and 'star-gazing was a good idea' with peter x reader,...
question: hi! for a little blurb request... with 'don't get up - i'll do it' and 'star-gazing was a good idea' with peter x reader, please? thank you 💖💖💗
answer:
of course! i loved writing this, it was super cute!

you sighed contentedly as you lay beside your best friend on the cool grass looking up at the stars. being the nerd he was, peter had begged you to go stargazing with him, and being a bit of a nerd yourself you agreed. now you were lying together on the top of a hill that had been yours and peters favourite spot for years.

a cool breeze blew over the two of you and you shivered. you sat up, rubbing your arms trying to warm yourself up.

“are you cold y/n?” peter asked, worried.

“ya, but it’s fine, i’ll grab the blanket we brought.”

“don’t get up, i’ll do it.” peter replied, standing up to grab the fuzzy blanket you had brought for the two of you.

sitting back down, he wrapped the blanket around the two of you, and you curled up beside him. he smiled down at you, glad to see you happy. he had liked you for a long time, and was glad he could spend moments like these with you.

“y-y/n?” he asked.

“yes peter?” you replied, looking up at your best friend. looking at the nervousness on his face your heart started to beat faster. was he going to tell you that he liked you too? see, you had been crushing on peter for years, and even though mj had told you that she could tell he liked you forever, you never believed her. until maybe now. you could swear something felt different in the way he looked at you at that moment.

peter swallowed thickly. “you… um you look really p-pretty tonight. and… well you always look pretty. i-i really like you y/n. as more than just friends…”

“oh pete…” you breathed softly. “i like you too.”

peter smiled, and you smiled back to him. the air was buzzing with tension and you just wanted to grab his face and kiss him right then and there.

“c-can i maybe um… k-kiss you?”

you smiled and nodded, your heart beating faster than ever. he moved his hand up to rest on your cheek, his thumb lightly running under your eyelid. he leaned down and you lifted your head up, waiting a moment before peter lightly pressed his lips over yours. his other arm moved up to the back of your neck and you leaned into his touch, your arm draping over his shoulder while the other tangled in his soft curls.

too soon you broke apart, foreheads resting against each other’s.

“i guess stargazing was a good idea.” you whispered, smiling widely at peter, leaning up to peck him on the lips.

“yeah, i guess it was.” he whispered back his face glowing with happiness.

the two of you settled back into snuggling together, the way you were before. but nothing was the same anymore.

summary: Oh, Little One, You Just Need to be Brave - mainstreamelectricalparade - Iron Man (Movies) [Archive of Our Own]
title: Oh, Little One, You Just Need to be Brave - mainstreamelectricalparade - Iron Man (Movies) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Rhodey rounded the corner into the living room, closely followed by Peter, who was looking down at his feet as he held onto Rhodey’s hand, and didn’t see Tony right away.

He looked sadder than Tony had ever seen him.

Rhodey crouched down to Peter’s level. “Look, buddy, look who’s here for you.”

Peter’s eyes went wide, quickly filling with tears.

“Dad?” he whispered, not moving from where he stood, like his feet were rooted to the carpet.

This is an Iron Man 3 fic, which, fair warning, I haven’t actually seen. Another fair warning: THIS IS SUPER HEARTBREAKING, PREPARE YOURSELVES.

summary: It’s That Easy (Spideypool)(Final)
title: It’s That Easy (Spideypool)(Final)
body:
Part One

Part Two

Part Three

Part Four

*********************

By the end of his heat with Wade, Peter was bruised from being held so tight and sore from being knotted and so tired that he slept for a full sixteen hours after it was all said and done. He woke up with a smile on his face though, glowing in the way that only post-heat Omega’s did, eyes shining and skin flushed and it was a vast contrast to how completely fucked out Wade looked– exhausted and dehydrated and worn the hell out because wow did heat take a lot of energy.

“To be fair–” he groaned when Peter jumped on the bed and clambered over to sit on Wade’s waist. “To be fair, Alpha’s gotta do all the work with this sort of thing. You just get to lay there and take knots. No wonder you aren’t exhausted.”

“I get to lay there and take knots?!” Peter’s mouth fell open. “Are you serious with that!”

“Don’t worry, baby boy.” A jaw cracking yawn, and Wade yanked the Omega down to snuggle. “You take knots like a champ. You should be real proud of that.”

“WADE!”

Even with Wade’s less than stellar conversation skills, it had been a good heat and Peter was a happy, satisfied Omega.

He’d be happier though, if the Alpha had finished what he’d started so many times, and turned the bruises at Peter’s bonding spot into a full fledged bite, finishing his claim.

In fact, Peter would have been happy if Wade had told him I love you back just once, but every time the Alpha had just tucked him close and kissed him breathless and left it alone.

It was fine. The Alpha wanted to take things slow and that was fine. Peter was a little thrown by just how quickly he was ready and willing to bond with Wade, considering how much he’d balked at anything resembling settling down with Harry, and maybe it was crazy but it was also easy, so easy to be with Wade that Peter found himself wondering why he’d wasted any time with any one else.

So they hadn’t bonded yet. It was fine.

Wade didn’t claim Peter the second heat together either, even though by that point he had moved the Omega out of the shitty studio apartment and into his shockingly nice place downtown.

“Uh yes, question?” Peter asked the first time Wade brought him home to the high rise complex. “Why the fuck do you hang out at Weasel’s if you have a place like this to come home to?”

“I dunno.” Wade shrugged and dropped the one measly box of Peter’s things in the bedroom closet. “Just didn’t feel right, didn’t really feel like I belonged.” His eyes flickered red then back to hazel as he looked Peter over with a possessive growl. “Didn’t feel like home yet.”

“Oh.” Peter’s hand went unconsciously to his neck, scratching over the disappointingly clear skin. “And now?”

“Apparently all it took is a hot Omega with legs that don’t quit to make it feel like home.” Wade held out his hand and pulled Peter close, burying his nose in the thick hair and rumbling approvingly. “M’glad you’re here, baby boy. Glad you wanted to move in with me.”

They’d gone shopping after that, shopping for everything from new sheets to dishes and curtains and then spent the rest of the weekend christening every available surface in the three bedroom apartment, teasing and laughing and saying “I love you” in a hundred different ways, but when Peter’s heat came on, Wade still didn’t bite him.

Well no, he bit him several times– at the juncture of hip and thigh just sharp enough to make Peter shriek, softer nibbles along Peter’s jaw, harder in the meat of Peter’s ass before Wade spread him open and took Peter apart with nothing more than his tongue and fingers–

But not where Peter wanted him to, not where the Omega needed him to.

So before his third heat with Wade rolled around, Peter sat his Alpha down and just asked him point blank– “Why won’t you bond with me?”

“What?” Wade froze with a sandwich halfway to his mouth, right in the middle of carbo-loading to prepare for the next few days since neither of them remembered to eat anything other than granola bars during heat. “What– what do you mean?”

“I mean, this will be our third heat together.” Peter pointed out. “And before this, you helped me through three other ones, even if you weren’t you know–helping me. And I thought you’d bite me the first time when you told me it wasn’t just a trauma bond between us but you didn’t.”

“I thought it was too soon.” Wade swallowed a big bite and cleared his throat. “Our first time– I didn’t want you to regret it.”

“Well what about last time?” Peter countered. “You moved me in here and I know you love me and I know you imprinted mate on me, and obviously I–” he blushed and Wade didn’t think he’d ever get used to how precious that was. “–obviously I’m fine with it. Omega’s don’t imprint like you Alpha’s do, but I always knew you were good for me, knew I was safe with you, right from the start.”

“That’s good, sweetheart.” Wade’s voice was a little hoarse and he cleared his throat again. “I’m glad you always knew you were safe with me.”

“I did.” The Omega bit his lip and peeked up from his lashes shyly, knowing damn well his Alpha couldn’t resist it, and Wade proved his point by just chucking the sandwich and grabbing Peter up into his lap. “So why don’t you want to bond with me?”

Wade sighed, sifting his Omega’s hair through his fingers for a long minute as he though. “Pete, you don’t want a mate.”

“Sounds fake, but okay.” Peter frowned. “Why would you think I don’t want a mate?”

“You left Harry because he wanted a bond and kids and all that sort of crap.” Wade shrugged. “I didn’t want to assume you’d change your mind for me. Just because you feel safe with me doesn’t mean you want to deal with the glitter covered trash party that is my general self forever. And you’re so incoherent during your heat, even if you asked me to bite you I’d always feel like–”

He stopped, shook his head. “–I’d always feel like I took advantage of you. You don’t know what you’re saying during heat, in fact you should hear half the shit you say. Don’t get me wrong, I love all of it but if someone was listening–”

“If someone was listening?” Peter interrupted, eyes sparking with laughter. “And who exactly would be listening to the nonsense I say during my heat?”

“Fuckin no one.” Wade snarled, eyes red at even the thought of anyone ever hearing the way Peter talked during heat, anyone else being privy to moments that were meant to be between him and his mate. “No one else listens.”

“Such a big scary Alpha.” Peter pushed their foreheads together and growled playfully, reveling in the freedom he had to tease and push and just be real with his Alpha. It was another thing he hadn’t realized he didn’t have with Harry and he loved that he had it with Wade.

“And by the way?” he continued. ““I left Harry because he refused to get me suppressants so I could continue school. He tore up internship papers because he didn’t want me working outside the home.”

“But you–” he inched closer, purring quietly when Wade put both arms around him. “–you’ve gone out and got me suppressants for over six months now. Yesterday you wrote out a ridiculous sized check so I can go back to school for the spring semester. I turned down a job last month because it meant an hour subway ride each way, so you offered to buy me a car instead.”

“You’re my mate, Pete.” The Alpha’s eyes shuttered a possessive shade of red again as he stroked his thumb over the bonding spot at the base of Peter’s neck. “And I’m gonna do whatever it takes to keep you happy, just like I did when we first met and just like I’ve been trying to do the last few months. You’re my mate whether there’s a mark on you or not, it’s enough for me Pete.”

“You’d make it that easy?” Peter whispered. “You’d give up the security of a bond if you thought I didn’t want it.”

“I’d make it that easy.” Wade confirmed. “I’m not going to try and tie you down like Harry did. I want you to be happy and that’s my entire extensive thought process on the matter.”

“And if I wanted to be tied to you?” There went Peter with that shy look again, all soft eyes and long lashes and hesitant smile. “What about then? Would you still tell me no?”

“The hell I would. If I knew you wanted me as mate I’d bend you over that chair and fuck you six ways to Sunday.” Wade confirmed. “And when your heat comes in a few days, I’m gonna bite the shit out of you.”

“You’re so romantic, you make my heart flutter.” Peter teased and Wade growled back at him. “I love you, Alpha my Alpha. Don’t you love me?”

“I love you, Pete.” Wade whispered. “I can’t wait to make you mine.”

“I’m yours, Alpha.” Peter whispered back. “I’m already yours.”

*******************

*******************

The internship at Stark Industries was everything Peter had ever imagined it would be, and he didn’t know how Wade had managed to even get him an interview, but Peter had been here for just over a month and it was everything he had ever imagined it would be.

And then it all got even better, when Tony Stark showed up at his desk one day to ask questions about the line of suppressants Peter was working on.

“So, no negative side effects?” The Alpha asked, flipping through Peter’s work. “Based off of blood types and specific biology markers? You know, this could be very expensive, manufacturing a different suppressant for every Omega out there. Expensive to the point of almost not viable.”

“It could be very expensive.” Peter nodded. “And lots of companies would take advantage of that, but a company as big as Stark Industries could afford to sell it at a lower price. Plus, if you provided it free of charge to the public health clinics and people on state insurance, then you’d get enough of a tax break as to make it affordable even for people who don’t have insurance, which means every Omega in the country could afford good suppressants which means we could work and go to school which only helps everything about the economy, right?”

“And also–” Peter took a deep breath and kept right on talking, taking the surprised smile on the Alpha’s face as permission. “– since suddenly having Omegas able to work consistently will raise the numbers of the work force, you could offer more scholarships and open up more internships to bring the best out of the bigger classes here to SI.”

“You’ve put a lot of thought into this.” Mr. Stark said, scanning a few more pages quickly. “Right up into my financial issues, hm?”

“Oh well–” Peter flushed nervously. “I mean–”

“No, it’s good.” The Alpha handed him back the file. “My Omega Steve struggles with suppressant issues, mostly finding correct doses for his size that aren’t toxic. Your ideas could change his life, not to mention the lives of several other Omega’s that I personally know, and of course, literal millions of Omega’s if your ideas actually work.

“I–”

“Let’s have lunch.” Tony checked his watch. “I’ll buy, you can talk. Do you eat shawarma? It doesn’t matter, you’re going to love it. Come on, lets go.”

******************

Later that night over a dinner of steaks and vegetables, Peter was nearly bursting with information about his day, chattering as fast as he could and barely letting Wade get a word in edgewise, and Wade just grinned over it.

When he finally slowed down a little, Wade snarked– “Enjoying the internship, are you?”

The Omega launched himself towards his Alpha, burrowing into his lap and mouthing over his bonding mark and biting at him with soft trills and purrs. “I’m so happy.” he muttered, squashing even closer. “So happy, Alpha. My life is everything I could ever want right now.”

“Well that’s real good, Pete.” Wade pretended to think for a minute. “And all it took was bonding with me, right? We should bottle that and sell it on TV. Is true happiness just finding the right Alpha? Is really that easy?”

Peter rolled his eyes, but his smile for his mate was very very soft. “I guess it’s really that easy.”

******************************

“I mean, this will be our third heat together.” Peter pointed out. “And before this, you helped me through three other ones, even if you weren’t you know–helping me. And I thought you’d bite me the first time when you told me it wasn’t just a trauma bond between us but you didn’t.”

“I thought it was too soon.” Wade swallowed a big bite and cleared his throat. “Our first time– I didn’t want you to regret it.”

“Well what about last time?” Peter countered. “You moved me in here and I know you love me and I know you imprinted mate on me, and obviously I–” he blushed and Wade didn’t think he’d ever get used to how precious that was. “–obviously I’m fine with it. Omega’s don’t imprint like you Alpha’s do, but I always knew you were good for me, knew I was safe with you, right from the start.”

“That’s good, sweetheart.” Wade’s voice was a little hoarse and he cleared his throat again. “I’m glad you always knew you were safe with me.”

“I did.” The Omega bit his lip and peeked up from his lashes shyly, knowing damn well his Alpha couldn’t resist it, and Wade proved his point by just chucking the sandwich and grabbing Peter up into his lap. “So why don’t you want to bond with me?”

Wade sighed, sifting his Omega’s hair through his fingers for a long minute as he though. “Pete, you don’t want a mate.”

“Sounds fake, but okay.” Peter frowned. “Why would you think I don’t want a mate?”

“You left Harry because he wanted a bond and kids and all that sort of crap.” Wade shrugged. “I didn’t want to assume you’d change your mind for me. Just because you feel safe with me doesn’t mean you want to deal with the glitter covered trash party that is my general self forever. And you’re so incoherent during your heat, even if you asked me to bite you I’d always feel like–”

He stopped, shook his head. “–I’d always feel like I took advantage of you. You don’t know what you’re saying during heat, in fact you should hear half the shit you say. Don’t get me wrong, I love all of it but if someone was listening–”

“If someone was listening?” Peter interrupted, eyes sparking with laughter. “And who exactly would be listening to the nonsense I say during my heat?”

“Fuckin no one.” Wade snarled, eyes red at even the thought of anyone ever hearing the way Peter talked during heat, anyone else being privy to moments that were meant to be between him and his mate. “No one else listens.”

“Such a big scary Alpha.” Peter pushed their foreheads together and growled playfully, reveling in the freedom he had to tease and push and just be real with his Alpha. It was another thing he hadn’t realized he didn’t have with Harry and he loved that he had it with Wade.

“And by the way?” he continued. ““I left Harry because he refused to get me suppressants so I could continue school. He tore up internship papers because he didn’t want me working outside the home.”

“But you–” he inched closer, purring quietly when Wade put both arms around him. “–you’ve gone out and got me suppressants for over six months now. Yesterday you wrote out a ridiculous sized check so I can go back to school for the spring semester. I turned down a job last month because it meant an hour subway ride each way, so you offered to buy me a car instead.”

“You’re my mate, Pete.” The Alpha’s eyes shuttered a possessive shade of red again as he stroked his thumb over the bonding spot at the base of Peter’s neck. “And I’m gonna do whatever it takes to keep you happy, just like I did when we first met and just like I’ve been trying to do the last few months. You’re my mate whether there’s a mark on you or not, it’s enough for me Pete.”

“You’d make it that easy?” Peter whispered. “You’d give up the security of a bond if you thought I didn’t want it.”

“I’d make it that easy.” Wade confirmed. “I’m not going to try and tie you down like Harry did. I want you to be happy and that’s my entire extensive thought process on the matter.”

“And if I wanted to be tied to you?” There went Peter with that shy look again, all soft eyes and long lashes and hesitant smile. “What about then? Would you still tell me no?”

“The hell I would. If I knew you wanted me as mate I’d bend you over that chair and fuck you six ways to Sunday.” Wade confirmed. “And when your heat comes in a few days, I’m gonna bite the shit out of you.”

“You’re so romantic, you make my heart flutter.” Peter teased and Wade growled back at him. “I love you, Alpha my Alpha. Don’t you love me?”

“I love you, Pete.” Wade whispered. “I can’t wait to make you mine.”

“I’m yours, Alpha.” Peter whispered back. “I’m already yours.”

*******************

*******************

The internship at Stark Industries was everything Peter had ever imagined it would be, and he didn’t know how Wade had managed to even get him an interview, but Peter had been here for just over a month and it was everything he had ever imagined it would be.

And then it all got even better, when Tony Stark showed up at his desk one day to ask questions about the line of suppressants Peter was working on.

“So, no negative side effects?” The Alpha asked, flipping through Peter’s work. “Based off of blood types and specific biology markers? You know, this could be very expensive, manufacturing a different suppressant for every Omega out there. Expensive to the point of almost not viable.”

“It could be very expensive.” Peter nodded. “And lots of companies would take advantage of that, but a company as big as Stark Industries could afford to sell it at a lower price. Plus, if you provided it free of charge to the public health clinics and people on state insurance, then you’d get enough of a tax break as to make it affordable even for people who don’t have insurance, which means every Omega in the country could afford good suppressants which means we could work and go to school which only helps everything about the economy, right?”

“And also–” Peter took a deep breath and kept right on talking, taking the surprised smile on the Alpha’s face as permission. “– since suddenly having Omegas able to work consistently will raise the numbers of the work force, you could offer more scholarships and open up more internships to bring the best out of the bigger classes here to SI.”

“You’ve put a lot of thought into this.” Mr. Stark said, scanning a few more pages quickly. “Right up into my financial issues, hm?”

“Oh well–” Peter flushed nervously. “I mean–”

“No, it’s good.” The Alpha handed him back the file. “My Omega Steve struggles with suppressant issues, mostly finding correct doses for his size that aren’t toxic. Your ideas could change his life, not to mention the lives of several other Omega’s that I personally know, and of course, literal millions of Omega’s if your ideas actually work.

“I–”

“Let’s have lunch.” Tony checked his watch. “I’ll buy, you can talk. Do you eat shawarma? It doesn’t matter, you’re going to love it. Come on, lets go.”

******************

Later that night over a dinner of steaks and vegetables, Peter was nearly bursting with information about his day, chattering as fast as he could and barely letting Wade get a word in edgewise, and Wade just grinned over it.

When he finally slowed down a little, Wade snarked– “Enjoying the internship, are you?”

The Omega launched himself towards his Alpha, burrowing into his lap and mouthing over his bonding mark and biting at him with soft trills and purrs. “I’m so happy.” he muttered, squashing even closer. “So happy, Alpha. My life is everything I could ever want right now.”

“Well that’s real good, Pete.” Wade pretended to think for a minute. “And all it took was bonding with me, right? We should bottle that and sell it on TV. Is true happiness just finding the right Alpha? Is really that easy?”

Peter rolled his eyes, but his smile for his mate was very very soft. “I guess it’s really that easy.”

summary: Crush - T.H.
body:
Crush - T.H.

MASTERLIST

This was requested by @tom-hollands-wife and I honestly thought it turned out kinda cute.

Warnings: slight makeout? Idek anymore but like no swearing for once.

Being RDJ’s daughter was about as good as it sounded, therefore it was also as bad as it sounded. Paparazzi was hounding you as you tried to walk to your car. Today you were gonna go down to the studio and read with some guys for the role of Spiderman. You had heard of a few of em, but some of them you couldn’t even remember their names.

For you it was just a normal, annoying day of work. What with your role of Iron girl and all? It was kind of cool getting to work with your dad and everything, even playing his genius daughter in one of the best movie series there is. But with the contract came other things, like getting up at the crack of dawn so you could go read a script with someone you’ve never heard of.  

You went to meet up with your dad in the green room, but when you walked in, you saw a line of the guys in line to play Spiderman. One of them caught your eye, he was a bit taller than you with dark curly hair. His eyes were dark brown too and you could swear you saw your own reflection in them. You turned around to keep walking and one of the managers came and ushered you through to your dad.

“Hey, where were you?” he asked, enveloping you in a hug.  

“I got caught by paps before I could leave. Chased me down to my car.” you smiled. One of the assistants came in the room holding two pieces of paper. One was for you and the other was for your dad. You quickly read over it, seeing how your character, Kayla, otherwise known as Kay, is all of a sudden going to be the love interest for the new Spiderman. Well then, this seems like an odd turn of events. After the last movie, your character was already in a relationship. Either way you just wanted to get it over with so you could go home and watch Star Wars.

“Shall we get to it?” you asked your dad. He quickly nodded and you were taken to separate rooms, with several boys already in each of them.  

“Alright,” the manager said, “First up on the list is BUtterfield, Asa.”

You definetly knew this name. Honestly you were kind of a fan. Asa put so much into every character he played and you were sure that it was almost no competition. He would definitely get it. Of course he wasn’t traditionally as attractive as the other boys in the room. Most certainly not as much as the boy you saw earlier. You tried to scan the room for him again and found his dark brown eyes again. He gave you a small smile and nod of his head before another pair of eyes blocked your vision.

“Hey there.” Asa reached out his hand for you to shake and you gladly took it, returning him a smile as well.

“Hey. I’m gonna be honest. I’m a fan.” You giggled.

“Really? A fan? Of me?” You nodded to him again and his eyes widened a bit. “But, I’m a fan of you.” He laughed.

“Well then this should be fun.”

-

After Asa’s read, you were convinced they would send everyone else home because it was really good. The chemistry between you two was actually great. However there was still something that the casting directors were looking for that wasn’t there with Asa.

Even though Asa’s audition was still the best, they kept having you read with the other boys. You kind of got bored with them until they called up the boy you saw earlier.

“Holland, Thomas.”

He walked over to you with a nervous smile, reaching his hand out for you. You shook it and smiled back. You could feel his hand shaking when you touched it.

“Hey, I’m Tom.” He had an accent like Asa. Must be English.

“Hey, I’m y/n.”

“I know.” He replied, his smile had grown and he became more comfortable as his hand stopped shaking. Wait. Why were you still holding his hand. You both dropped you hands at the realization and started over to the camera area.

By the time he had gone, you had the page memorized and so did he.

“Alright, take it from the top but ignore Robert’s lines.” He nodded and they gave you guys the signal that the camera was rolling.

“You know something? I um, I haven’t introduced myself. I-I’m Peter. Peter Parker.” His accent was now that of a Queens or Brooklyn type and it impressed you how good it sounded.

“Yeah I guessed as much, my dad said you were gonna be hanging around here for a while.” You couldn’t tear yourself from his eyes. It was almost unnatural and seemed unprofessional. Still you guys kept going.

“Oh he did? Did he tell you about about my internship?”

“Yeah, something along the lines of you also being a superhero.” You smiled and smirked, giving him the sense of sarcasm.

“Oh, so you know.” His shoulders dropped a bit.

“About you being the friendly neighborhood spider-guy? Yeah.” You turned around as scripted, laughing as you took a step.

“Its actually Spiderman.” He mumbled to which you stopped in your tracks. You turned around.

“You’re like 12.” You rolled your eyes.

“15.”

“Well I’m 16.” You retored, placing your hands on your hips.

“So?”

“So I’m older than you.”

“Which means?”

“It means I’ll call you spider guy if I want to.” You smiled cheekily.

He looked slightly annoyed and flustered.

He looked back down to his feet and didn’t seem to have anything else to say. Good.

“See ya later Spiderman.”

You turned and walked away. Unbeknownst to you he was smiling at your last words.

The director yelled cut and then it all hit you. That wasn’t real. It sure did feel real. Wow. That kid was good.

You guys said your goodbyes and then you were taken back to the green room. After Tom they sent the rest of the guys home. They said that they had all they needed for consideration.

-

A few weeks later you were notified that the new spiderman was posted on Instagram.

You opened insta and clear as day Tom’s name was posted.

You weren’t surprised that Asa’s name wasn’t up there. His performance was good but Tom’s was so good you thought it was real.

You were really excited to be working with him. You honestly thought he was attractive and he seemed to think you were too. Maybe on set he might happen to ask you out or something? Who knows?

Finally the day came for the first shots with you and Tom. There wasn’t a lot of filming going on with you two though so you two just kind of thing out in each other’s trailers, getting to know each other. The next few weeks went just the same. Filming scenes and then hanging out.

He was really funny. And cute. And over all a great guy in general. He also had a really cute dog back at home in England, which for you, was a big bonus. You love dogs. His dog was a grey staffie named tessa and was absolutely adorable.

“Hey, I uh, wanted to ask you if uh maybe you might wanna see a movie with me tomorrow night. I figured cause we both have tomorrow off it might be fun.” He got a little but quieter as his anxiety took over.

“I would love to.” His head shot up and he smiled.

“Cool.” He started looking at your lips then back at your eyes. You both started leaning in and before you knew it, he closed the gap between you. Not only was this boy the epitome of perfect. He was also a great kisser.

You both started moving your lips in sync and before either of you knew it, you were straddling his hips, hands on his face and his in your hair.

All of a sudden your trailer door swung open.

“Y/n- hey! What’s going on here?” You dad walked in and you looked up at him in terror. So did Tom. He looked absolutely mortified.

“Dad we um-”

“No I get it. Tom you better watch yourself.” He said to which you crawled off Tom.

“I’m sorry sir. I was..” he trailed off. There really wasn’t a good excuse for what was happening.

“Do I really need to get a babysitter for you two?” He joked, walking over to sit by you.

“I am not going to have to worry about anything am I?” He asked, to which you shook your head.

“Okay cool. I was going to send someone to get coffee I didn’t know if you wanted anything.”

“Actually dad, I think I’m okay.”

Warnings: slight makeout? Idek anymore but like no swearing for once.

Being RDJ’s daughter was about as good as it sounded, therefore it was also as bad as it sounded. Paparazzi was hounding you as you tried to walk to your car. Today you were gonna go down to the studio and read with some guys for the role of Spiderman. You had heard of a few of em, but some of them you couldn’t even remember their names.

For you it was just a normal, annoying day of work. What with your role of Iron girl and all? It was kind of cool getting to work with your dad and everything, even playing his genius daughter in one of the best movie series there is. But with the contract came other things, like getting up at the crack of dawn so you could go read a script with someone you’ve never heard of.  

You went to meet up with your dad in the green room, but when you walked in, you saw a line of the guys in line to play Spiderman. One of them caught your eye, he was a bit taller than you with dark curly hair. His eyes were dark brown too and you could swear you saw your own reflection in them. You turned around to keep walking and one of the managers came and ushered you through to your dad.

“Hey, where were you?” he asked, enveloping you in a hug.  

“I got caught by paps before I could leave. Chased me down to my car.” you smiled. One of the assistants came in the room holding two pieces of paper. One was for you and the other was for your dad. You quickly read over it, seeing how your character, Kayla, otherwise known as Kay, is all of a sudden going to be the love interest for the new Spiderman. Well then, this seems like an odd turn of events. After the last movie, your character was already in a relationship. Either way you just wanted to get it over with so you could go home and watch Star Wars.

“Shall we get to it?” you asked your dad. He quickly nodded and you were taken to separate rooms, with several boys already in each of them.  

“Alright,” the manager said, “First up on the list is BUtterfield, Asa.”

You definetly knew this name. Honestly you were kind of a fan. Asa put so much into every character he played and you were sure that it was almost no competition. He would definitely get it. Of course he wasn’t traditionally as attractive as the other boys in the room. Most certainly not as much as the boy you saw earlier. You tried to scan the room for him again and found his dark brown eyes again. He gave you a small smile and nod of his head before another pair of eyes blocked your vision.

“Hey there.” Asa reached out his hand for you to shake and you gladly took it, returning him a smile as well.

“Hey. I’m gonna be honest. I’m a fan.” You giggled.

“Really? A fan? Of me?” You nodded to him again and his eyes widened a bit. “But, I’m a fan of you.” He laughed.

“Well then this should be fun.”

-

After Asa’s read, you were convinced they would send everyone else home because it was really good. The chemistry between you two was actually great. However there was still something that the casting directors were looking for that wasn’t there with Asa.

Even though Asa’s audition was still the best, they kept having you read with the other boys. You kind of got bored with them until they called up the boy you saw earlier.

“Holland, Thomas.”

He walked over to you with a nervous smile, reaching his hand out for you. You shook it and smiled back. You could feel his hand shaking when you touched it.

“Hey, I’m Tom.” He had an accent like Asa. Must be English.

“Hey, I’m y/n.”

“I know.” He replied, his smile had grown and he became more comfortable as his hand stopped shaking. Wait. Why were you still holding his hand. You both dropped you hands at the realization and started over to the camera area.

By the time he had gone, you had the page memorized and so did he.

“Alright, take it from the top but ignore Robert’s lines.” He nodded and they gave you guys the signal that the camera was rolling.

“You know something? I um, I haven’t introduced myself. I-I’m Peter. Peter Parker.” His accent was now that of a Queens or Brooklyn type and it impressed you how good it sounded.

“Yeah I guessed as much, my dad said you were gonna be hanging around here for a while.” You couldn’t tear yourself from his eyes. It was almost unnatural and seemed unprofessional. Still you guys kept going.

“Oh he did? Did he tell you about about my internship?”

“Yeah, something along the lines of you also being a superhero.” You smiled and smirked, giving him the sense of sarcasm.

“Oh, so you know.” His shoulders dropped a bit.

“About you being the friendly neighborhood spider-guy? Yeah.” You turned around as scripted, laughing as you took a step.

“Its actually Spiderman.” He mumbled to which you stopped in your tracks. You turned around.

“You’re like 12.” You rolled your eyes.

“15.”

“Well I’m 16.” You retored, placing your hands on your hips.

“So?”

“So I’m older than you.”

“Which means?”

“It means I’ll call you spider guy if I want to.” You smiled cheekily.

He looked slightly annoyed and flustered.

He looked back down to his feet and didn’t seem to have anything else to say. Good.

“See ya later Spiderman.”

You turned and walked away. Unbeknownst to you he was smiling at your last words.

The director yelled cut and then it all hit you. That wasn’t real. It sure did feel real. Wow. That kid was good.

You guys said your goodbyes and then you were taken back to the green room. After Tom they sent the rest of the guys home. They said that they had all they needed for consideration.

-

A few weeks later you were notified that the new spiderman was posted on Instagram.

You opened insta and clear as day Tom’s name was posted.

You weren’t surprised that Asa’s name wasn’t up there. His performance was good but Tom’s was so good you thought it was real.

You were really excited to be working with him. You honestly thought he was attractive and he seemed to think you were too. Maybe on set he might happen to ask you out or something? Who knows?

Finally the day came for the first shots with you and Tom. There wasn’t a lot of filming going on with you two though so you two just kind of thing out in each other’s trailers, getting to know each other. The next few weeks went just the same. Filming scenes and then hanging out.

He was really funny. And cute. And over all a great guy in general. He also had a really cute dog back at home in England, which for you, was a big bonus. You love dogs. His dog was a grey staffie named tessa and was absolutely adorable.

“Hey, I uh, wanted to ask you if uh maybe you might wanna see a movie with me tomorrow night. I figured cause we both have tomorrow off it might be fun.” He got a little but quieter as his anxiety took over.

“I would love to.” His head shot up and he smiled.

“Cool.” He started looking at your lips then back at your eyes. You both started leaning in and before you knew it, he closed the gap between you. Not only was this boy the epitome of perfect. He was also a great kisser.

You both started moving your lips in sync and before either of you knew it, you were straddling his hips, hands on his face and his in your hair.

All of a sudden your trailer door swung open.

“Y/n- hey! What’s going on here?” You dad walked in and you looked up at him in terror. So did Tom. He looked absolutely mortified.

“Dad we um-”

“No I get it. Tom you better watch yourself.” He said to which you crawled off Tom.

“I’m sorry sir. I was..” he trailed off. There really wasn’t a good excuse for what was happening.

“Do I really need to get a babysitter for you two?” He joked, walking over to sit by you.

“I am not going to have to worry about anything am I?” He asked, to which you shook your head.

“Okay cool. I was going to send someone to get coffee I didn’t know if you wanted anything.”

“Actually dad, I think I’m okay.”

And with that he was off. He left your trailer door open so you went over and shut it.

“So…” you trailed off, looking at Tom. “Where were we?”

summary: Hi! Just wondering.. are Johnny and Peter the same age?
question: Hi! Just wondering.. are Johnny and Peter the same age?
answer:
Johnny and Peter are roughly the same age in 616, yes. Johnny got his powers in the shuttle accident when he was 16; Peter was bit by the spider when he was 15. These two things happened relatively closely together on the timeline. There’s even a scene in Fantastic Four #35 where they’re both scoping out the same college, State U:

Speaking of college, even though Johnny’s a little older than Peter, Peter was actually enrolled in college first. Johnny took a semester’s gap before enrolling at Metro U. Their schools even had a football team rivalry:

(Amazing Spider-Man #44)

Even though Johnny’s technically around a year older, because of their respective personalities and circumstances – Johnny, the baby of the Fantastic Four, and Peter, the loner vigilante who had at a young age occasionally been his aunt’s caretaker, because at that time in canon Aunt May was frequently in poor health, not to mention being the family breadwinner – and because Spider-Man’s true age was a bit of a mystery (Johnny knew he was about his own age, but not the specifics), both Peter and Johnny tend to act like Peter’s the older between the two of them. 

(Marvel Team Up #2 – Peter, please, you’re the same age.)

If you’re looking for their current comics ages, while I personally think it’s ridiculous that Marvel won’t just up and let 616 Peter be 30 already given the breadth of his canon, I believe a recent interview with one of his writers identified his current age as 28, which would make Johnny approximately ~31 – though there’s only about a year between them at the conception of the characters, in Jonathan Hickman’s Fantastic Four run Johnny spent two years trapped in the Negative Zone, although it’s not clear how much of that he was conscious/alive for or how much he actually aged.

summary: Never Go Home Alone
title: Never Go Home Alone
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2ERIZna

by Gruoch

“Am I being kidnapped right now?” Peter asks.

“Only if you don’t want to be here,” Stranger Lady cheerfully replies.

Peter peers out the car windows at the scrubby, terra-cotta colored terrain that stretches off for miles all around them, terminating on the distant horizon in huge pastel-hued mountains.

“Um. Where exactly is here?”

______________

In which Peter’s twenty-first birthday celebration veers wildly off course, Rhodey reluctantly plays the grizzled veteran detective, and this whole mentoring young superheroes thing might just kill Tony.
